comment: A very good lab professor who is always willing to help with whatever you need.

Does not care about how many questions you ask and is willing to walk you through any lab as much times as you need. Grades mostly came from lab worksheets which she can help along the way if you have any questions. Final was online and it was more difficult then I expected, but besides that she was a great teacher!!!
one of my fav lab professors, we were always out 1-2 hours early and she always made procedure sure clear. she reached back through email pretty quickly and was clear how she wanted stuff done
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Take this professor! They're respectful, helpful and very chill. Answered every dumb question I had. It was a very doable class. Just write in your lab notebook, do the lab, do weekly worksheets & complete 2 lab reports & 1 online final.

My only complaint is that sometimes she doesn't efficiently answer emails. She usually did, but sometimes she didnt or took a really long time. Otherwise, she is approachable and kind and doesn't over or under explain lab procedures. I almost always left lab about an hour early. Lab worksheets were manageable

I was going to but A as my grade but this teacher made a mistake and put a B in OwlExpress. I am now sitting at a 90.19 with all grades entered and she has placed a B letter grade. She has done this will plenty of students in my class and has not responded back to 1 email. It got so bad that my classmates have emailed the chairman and dean of KSU.

With the lab, she was not clear on what was to be expected and forgot to mention that we needed to buy items from the store that were not in the kit. LabFlow instructions stated the procedure, but she expected something completely different. Out of the 12 labs, I only passed 5. Her grading is ridiculous and doesnt respond to emails.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Jaqueline goes by Jackie and is very chill. I took her for ochem lab and instantly regretted not selecting her for lecture as well. She broke information down I was struggling with in Meades lecture class, and was overall super helpful in correcting online grading mistakes as well as content. I think everyone should try to take her :)

Do you like scouring the internet for more information for lab reports because you didn't feel the 10min lecture got the point across? Do you enjoy spending hours on assignments only to get docked massive points because you didn't "cite your sources" or Labflow messed up your data tables? I busted my BUTT for an A. Expect the same.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: gives extremely vague directions but grades extremely harsh. doesn't help much in class. you could ask her a question, she will say you're right, and then she will mark it wrong on the lab report, takes 2 weeks to respond to emails. uncaring. do not take
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Shes a tough grader, but very responsive. I am taking her again for 3362L. She is the best and only option. Apparently, students have thought she is nit picky and do not always understand her expectations. I can see that. She drops your lowest quiz/project grades and offers ec opportunities for final!! Overall, shes a solid choice for org chem lab

Ms. Steiger was probably the best lab instructor i've had for chemistry. Her pre-lab lectures are not long and to the point. She does have a lot of assignments such as quizzes, pop quizzes, etc, but they are not bad at all. She does have a very specific way she wants her lab reports but all you ned to do is ask questions and she'll answer them.

FOLLOW the rubric to a T and you will be fine. She is super nit picky and will find anything if you missed it, so be detailed and make sure you included everything. Other than that, the is super nice and a great prof to have in the lab. She may seem kinda mean at first, but she gets way softer later on.

If you follow her rubrics and instructions to the T, you WILL make an A or B! If you decide to not follow her rubrics & instructions, you WILL fail. Lab write-ups are very straightforward and the final is easy. At times she was rude to us, but she had some personal stuff going on. Not the happiest person, but pretty easy if you do as she says.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is extremely nitpicky about the lab reports but as long as your format the lab reports correctly and follow the exact guidelines you can make an A on every single lab report. Responds to emails quickly and is very accessible outside of class. Also the concepts are easy to follow.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Her report expectations are a little fuzzy at first but email her and she'll answer quickly, but either way, it's hard to fall the reports if you at least submit something. She is very personable and easy to get along with.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--SO MANY PAPERS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Don't take her for lab. She isn't clear on what she wants, no rubric given. You can ask her what she wants, but points will always be taken off because she's such a nit picky grader. She's a perfectionist, so good luck on getting a decent lab grade.

Jackie is the best lab professor I have had so far at KSU. She tells you exactly what is expected on lab reports, and she is absolutely hilarious! If you're nice to her, she's a total homie. I'm not even finished with her lab this semester, and I definitely plan to take 3362L with her! I plan on making an easy A in her lab. TAKE HER, SHE'S AWESOME!

She is an awesome professor. She gives you the pre-lecture PowerPoints and you have to fill in a couple of things. You have a quiz every class period but she tells you what is on them and the other quizzes are for extra credit. Definitely take her if you can.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Clear grading criteria

comment: Jackie was fantastic! She was so willing to help, her pre-lab lectures were straightforward, and she was chill during lab. She was easy to reach and replied to emails quickly. If she lectured in organic chem I would take her in a heartbeat!

She's a tough grader and it feels nitpicky at times. However, if you pay attention to what she says in lab and in the materials on d2l, you can do well. Ask questions and put in effort if you feel unsure

She is a tough grader when it comes to lab reports. She gives very vague feedback. Her lectures are concise and straight to the point, and she tells you exactly what the topics are on your quizzes and final as well as what she wants on the lab report. Just be sure to take notes and listen.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: All around great character and knowledge, willing to work with you but you've gotta reach out
Dr. Professor Jackie is amazing. Fun to be with and grades easily. No other Organic Chemistry II Lab instructor compares

Professor Jurchenko is a brilliant chemist and undoubtedly cares about her students.  Just follow her guidelines and keep up with the material she provides and you will succeed.  Make sure to check that misc folder on D2L and do the right thing!

She is awesome! By far the best lab professor I have ever had. She goes a little fast, but I learned way more from her than I did in my lecture. She wants you to do well. I wish she taught organic chemistry lecture as well. I highly recommend taking her!!

Overall great lab instructor and person. She is tough on grading the lab reports but she is always there to help and answers emails usually within 24 hours except for maybe weekends. Make sure to print out every pre-lab slide and take it to class because it has blanks that she will fill in in class.  Took her for both org chem I & II.

She is a tough grader,but ask for feedback so u can improve. Talks fast but is clear what she wants. So helpful and nice/funny. Ask her anything during or after lab/ show her or email her your lab report as you work on it and she will help you. I suggest printing out her ppts so you can take notes during her prelab lecture to help with quizzes .

Jacky is awesome! She Is one of the best lab professors I have ever had. She's very clear about what she wants to see in your lab reports, and if you show it to her the day before you turn it in, she will help you fix things on it.  I would recommend her to anyone.

I had Dr Jurchenko for 3362 lab and she was awesome. Kind of humorous. Very smart and does expect you to know what you learned in 3361. I was told she is a tough grader but I didn't think so just do the lab write ups.

Her instructions on what she wants on a lab report are as clear as mud. Most people in my lab were getting Cs and below on lab reports and she offered little to no feedback on why.  She takes off big points for the slightest error. Rude and unapproachable. Wouldnt take again.

Jacky has a clear idea of what she wants to do and how to grade assignments. If you don't follow her rubric you WILL fail. But on the other hand if you follow the rubric EXACTLY as she has it you will most likely make an A. She also has a few quizzes and pop quizzes which add to your final exam grade. This class is an easy A if you do what she asks

Took her for both ocher labs! She is a little unclear on assignments, so ask questions and she will clarify. She has a very specific rubric for lab reports which isn't difficult, and there's occasional quizzes which are simple if you study. The final is straight from power points and past quizzes. TAKE!

Jackie is by far the best lab professor I've ever had. Makes everything easy to understand and very straight forward. I had a rather crappy lab time, 8pm, but I look forward to going every week because of her. So laid back and easy to get along with. I highly recommend her.
Best chem lab prof at KSU. Tough grader but an A is possible. Will take again

Took Jurchenko for Gen Chem II Lab over Summer 2011. Worst mistake of my life. She speeds through pre-lab lectures, doesn't care to help during lab, stands in the back of the room and stares the WHOLE time, not approachable at all. Plus, she locks the door sharply at the start of class. I am a very determined chem major, but her class was awful.

Was very helpful. Gives a few quizes & then some "spot checks" as extra credit that are worth 1 pt apiece towards your final exam. Everything was pretty straight forward and her test/quiz questions do not try to confuse you. Do make sure to cite where you got information when writing lab reports! I would definately take her again!

She is really hard for the lab. She graded one report on percent yield, limits the use of our supplies and time we get in lab. If we need more time or supplies we get points taken off. Also grades lab reports really harshly, barely an A's.

CITE EVERYTHING IN LAB WRITE-UPS!!! If you fart while writing a lab write-up make sure to give credit to the flatulence in the bibliography or she will write you up academic dishonesty. Overall incredible professor so far.

BEST Ochem Lab professor! Her quizzes are straight fwd; know the reactions and percent yield. She creates the lab final, which is similar to her quizzes. If you email her your lab report a few days before it's due, she'll send you feedback. Very easy going and laid back lab. Took her for both ochem labs. Highly recommended!

Her grading is the most difficult I have experienced for a lab. She posts guidelines, but if you add too much or too little she deducts points. That being said, she is a wonderful lab instructor and you can tell she loves what she does. Very helpful but the grading killed my grade for the class.
By far my favorite professor! She loves what she does and is more than willing to help! If you want a lab professor who really cares, choose Jackie! Highly Recommended!!!!

Had Jackie for 1152 Lab and she was great. A nice and eclectic chem professor with a good sense of humor. The lab was like any other intro chem lab, dry and not very helpful, but Jackie acknowledged this and dived the work among the groups so we usually got out of there within an hour.

I thought she was a great lab instructor. She is a little quirky, but it's nothing to dislike her over.  Anytime I asked a question, she gave a clear and polite answer. She does grade the lab reports harshly, but check around, the majority of lab instructors do.

I really like Jackie! She is a very funny, sarcastic, & cool lady. She's super particular about the work you turn in. The guidelines for the lab notebook are kind of ridiculous, & she grades the lab reports harshly. However, I still liked her and learned a lot in lab. She explains everything very clearly & tells you exactly how to do everything.

She's very sarcastic and rude. She makes the lab much harder than it should be. She grades lab reports very harshly. I attended every session, understood every lab, and did well in the lecture. However, I barely got a C in her lab. Ridiculous!

Jackie is awesome! She is very helpful and walks you through the experiments.  The quizes are on the ppt and the prior lab. She is very particular about her lab reports but in her defense she tells you what she's  looking for in advance. DOOR IS ALWAYS OPEN POLICY. She'll look at your rpt before you turn it in & answers all questions.

My best chem lab yet. The quizzes are taken from the pre-lab notes. The formal papers were tough so plan enough time to complete them. Definitely get help if you bomb the first one. But you can recover since the lowest paper and quiz grade is dropped. I liked her and look forward to taking her again.

She makes lab bearable. Quizes are easy & based on ppt.  The labs are long but she is helpful. She makes time to skim through your lab report if you bring it in early and she will catch stuff that can get you more points.

Jackie is cool, and her class is easy.  Follow the lab report outline to the letter and cover everything she ask.  she knows how to teach and her quizzes and exams are easy.  Just keep your note book up to date and you will have no problems in her class.
Excellent lab professor!!! Explains Organic Chemistry concepts in easy terms so it is understandable!! Recommend Ms. Jurchenko 100% only lab professor to take!!
She's a good teacher who knows the material and can teach. Her quizzes and tests are easy if you study the material. However, if you don't ask her on what she wants on the Lab reports you're doomed.

This is the best Lab Professor Ever! It is true she changes what she wants on the Lab Reports! However it is easy to find out what she wants. "Does not want them to be to long!" How great is that; comment that she favors women more! Could not be futher from the truth. YOU JUST HAVE TO KNOW WHAT YOUR DOING! Great Job Jackie see you next semester!

She is an awesome teacher, she goes everything in great detail and if you do not understand something she will make time to explain it to you. The only problem was for every week she changes what she wants on the reports. So you have to include everything and hope you get it all in there.
Her tests are very tough and she tends to favor women more on grading papers. She id very nice though.

SHE IS VERY UNCLEAR. SHE SEEMS VERY UNEXPERIENCED. I DIDN'T LIKE THE WAY SHE GRADED MY REPORTS. SHE TAKE POINTS OFF FOR USING WRONG PUNCTUATION. I CERTAINLY DO NOT RECOMMEND HER FOR ANY CHEMISTRY CLASS. YOU CAN TAKE HER FOR ENGLISH LESSONS!
No Comments
She is a pretty good professor.  She will try and help you understand the material.  She is confusing sometimes on what she wants from you though.
